title: The Creation of the World
summary: Genesis 1 describes how God created everything: the heavens, the earth, light, sky, land, seas, plants, stars, animals, and humans. It shows that God is powerful, creative, and has a purpose for everything He made.

faq.question: Why did God create the world in six days?
faq.answer: God chose to create in six days to show order and intentionality. Each day builds on the last and shows His thoughtful design.

faq.question: What does it mean that we are made in God's image?
faq.answer: It means we are created to reflect God's nature — with the ability to think, love, create, and have a relationship with Him.

faq.question: Why is the seventh day important?
faq.answer: God rested on the seventh day to show the importance of rest and reflection. It's also a reminder that our value isn’t just in doing but in being with God.
